sentence.text: Methods: Ten potentially functional single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) in seven prostate CSC marker genes, negative regulation of epithelial cell migration, photoreceptor cell maintenance, substrate-dependent cell migration, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, negative regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade, and CD44, were selected for analysis of their association with disease recurrence by Kaplan-Meier analysis and Cox regression in a cohort of 320 patients with localized prostate cancer receiving radical prostatectomy.

entity.text: negative regulation of epithelial cell migration
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
negative regulation of ERK1 and ERK2 cascade

sentence.text: Results: We identified one independent SNP, rs2394882, in negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II that was associated with prostate cancer recurrence (hazard ratio 0.32, 95% confidence interval 0.14-0.71, P = 0.005) after adjustment for known clinical predictors.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Further in silico functional analyses revealed that rs2394882 affects negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II expression, which in turn is significantly correlated with prostate cancer aggressiveness and patient prognosis.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
